Test Name: HEXB Gene Variant Analysis for Sandhoff Disease
Specimen Type: Genomic DNA extracted from peripheral blood, saliva, or buccal swab
Purpose: To detect pathogenic variants in the HEXB gene for the diagnosis of Sandhoff Disease
Container: Labeled microcentrifuge tube containing purified DNA
Equipment: PCR thermal cycler, next-generation sequencing (NGS) platform, Qubit fluorometer, and bioinformatics analysis tools
